component.name: DjangoConsoleOptions

option.name: myCustomStartScript

task.summary:
Add project configuration files for IDE setup
This commit includes generated `.idea` files for configuring the IDE. These files are necessary for managing project modules, VCS settings, and workspace preferences in the development environment.

Initialize Django project "Agenda"
Set up the initial structure for the Agenda project using Django 5.1.4. This includes default settings, ASGI and WSGI configuration, URL routing, and administrative scripts. The project uses SQLite as the default database and includes a basic setup for templates, middleware, and static files.

Add `core` app scaffold to project
Initialized the `core` app with default Django files, including models, views, and tests. Updated the settings to include `core` in the installed apps. This sets up the foundational structure for future development.

Add Event model, admin interface, and Django configuration
Introduced the Event model with associated fields and user relationship. Registered the model in the admin interface with a custom display configuration. Updated Django project settings, IDE configuration files, and migrations to reflect these changes.

Add initial agenda HTML templates
Created base templates for the agenda feature, including a main layout (`model-page.html`), header (`model-header.html`), and footer (`model-footer.html`). Implemented `agenda.html` to display a list of scheduled events dynamically. These templates provide a foundational structure for the agenda view.

Add user-specific event listing and homepage redirect
Introduced a view to list events filtered by the logged-in user. Updated the admin panel to display the `user` field and added a `get_date` method to the Event model for formatting. Modified URL routing to include a redirect from the homepage to the event listing.

Add login.html template for user authentication
This commit introduces a new HTML template for the login page. It includes fields for username and password, a CSRF token for security, and a form for submission using the POST method. This sets up the foundation for handling user authentication in the application.

Add login functionality with user authentication
Introduced two new URL patterns for login and login submission. Implemented `login_user` view for rendering the login page and `submit_login` view for authenticating user credentials. Added login requirement for listing events using Django's `login_required` decorator.

MESSAGE.value:
Add project configuration files for IDE setup
This commit includes generated `.idea` files for configuring the IDE. These files are necessary for managing project modules, VCS settings, and workspace preferences in the development environment.

Initialize Django project "Agenda"
Set up the initial structure for the Agenda project using Django 5.1.4. This includes default settings, ASGI and WSGI configuration, URL routing, and administrative scripts. The project uses SQLite as the default database and includes a basic setup for templates, middleware, and static files.

Add `core` app scaffold to project
Initialized the `core` app with default Django files, including models, views, and tests. Updated the settings to include `core` in the installed apps. This sets up the foundational structure for future development.

Add Event model, admin interface, and Django configuration
Introduced the Event model with associated fields and user relationship. Registered the model in the admin interface with a custom display configuration. Updated Django project settings, IDE configuration files, and migrations to reflect these changes.

Add initial agenda HTML templates
Created base templates for the agenda feature, including a main layout (`model-page.html`), header (`model-header.html`), and footer (`model-footer.html`). Implemented `agenda.html` to display a list of scheduled events dynamically. These templates provide a foundational structure for the agenda view.

Add user-specific event listing and homepage redirect
Introduced a view to list events filtered by the logged-in user. Updated the admin panel to display the `user` field and added a `get_date` method to the Event model for formatting. Modified URL routing to include a redirect from the homepage to the event listing.

Add login.html template for user authentication
This commit introduces a new HTML template for the login page. It includes fields for username and password, a CSRF token for security, and a form for submission using the POST method. This sets up the foundation for handling user authentication in the application.

Add login functionality with user authentication
Introduced two new URL patterns for login and login submission. Implemented `login_user` view for rendering the login page and `submit_login` view for authenticating user credentials. Added login requirement for listing events using Django's `login_required` decorator.

option.name: LAST_COMMIT_MESSAGE
option.value:
Add login functionality with user authentication
Introduced two new URL patterns for login and login submission. Implemented `login_user` view for rendering the login page and `submit_login` view for authenticating user credentials. Added login requirement for listing events using Django's `login_required` decorator.
